alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 9:18AM CDT until May 05 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas and Missouri... Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County. Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. .Heavy rainfall expected over the next 24 hours combined with saturated soils and elevated streamflow will lead to rivers rising above flood stage across the Little Osage and lower Marmaton Basins. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Marmaton River near Nevada. * WHEN...From this morning to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, minor flooding occurs near the gage site and affects low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 20.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. Tuesday morning at 930 AM CDT.
